channel.title: Cholesterol – Seven Countries Study
channel.description: Since 1947. The first major study to look at dietary components and patterns and lifestyle as risk factors for cardiovascular disease, over multiple countries and extended periods of time.

item.title: Global coronary risk in northern and southern Europe
item.dc:creator: SCS
item.description: Large differences in global CHD risk within Europe A re-analysis of the 10-year follow-up data of the SCS published in 2000 showed large differences between northern and southern Europe in the number of hard CHD events at the same level of the major risk factors serum cholesterol, blood pressure and smoking. The number of hard CHD [...]

item.title: From individual risk factors to global cardiovascular risk
item.dc:creator: SCS
item.description: Individual risk factors and CHD prevention in the past In the 1960s and 70s, the Seven Countries Study and many other studies identified serum cholesterol, systolic blood pressure and smoking as major risk factors of CHD. Since then, smoking cessation and dietary interventions were promoted for primary prevention with drug treatment recommended for strongly elevated [...]

item.title: Major risk factors and cardiovascular disease
item.dc:creator: SCS
item.description: High blood pressure and smoking were risk factors for three major CVDs while serum cholesterol predicted only CHD Blood pressure and cigarette smoking predicted overall cardiovascular disease mortality and each major individual cardiovascular disease: that is, coronary heart disease, other heart disease and stroke. Serum cholesterol predicted cardiovascular and coronary heart disease mortality. The association [...]

item.title: Cardiovascular risk factors and all-cause mortality in the elderly
item.dc:creator: SCS
item.description: In the FINE Study the relations of classic cardiovascular risk factors with subsequent all-cause mortality were investigated in men aged 65-84 at baseline.

item.title: Cardiovascular risk factors and depressive symptoms
item.dc:creator: SCS
item.description: Data showed that poor lung function in midlife was associated with steeper increases of depressive symptoms in old age.

item.title: Cardiovascular risk factors and dementia
item.dc:creator: SCS
item.description: Men with a history of CVD at baseline had a 94% higher risk of dementia compared to those with no history.

item.title: Saturated fat, serum cholesterol and coronary heart disease
item.dc:creator: SCS
item.description: The results show that the average intake of dietary saturated fat of the 16 cohorts was strongly correlated with average serum cholesterol level.

item.title: Serum cholesterol and coronary heart disease
item.dc:creator: SCS
item.description: Cholesterol found in the blood serum is, in higher quantities, associated with a higher incidence of coronary heart disease (CHD). This is the conclusion after observing serum cholesterol levels and CHD risk mortality for forty years.
